explanation: The issue arises because the program assumes that the input list A will always contain at least 64 elements (for the range 0 to 63) which may lead to an IndexError if the input list has fewer elements. To fix this, I replaced the loop range from '63' to 'len(A)' to ensure it only iterates up to the length of the list A.
fixed_code:
A = list(map(int,input().split()))
S = 0

import math

for i in range(len(A)):
    S = S + A[i]*(pow(2,i))
    
print(S)
